Activity: Log in, check emails. Briefly browse ArtStation for character and environment modeling inspiration.
Start blocking out the basic shapes for the main character model. Focus on the primary forms and proportions using Maya. I'll start with the torso and work outwards.

Refine the blockout of the character's limbs, paying close attention to the relative lengths and thicknesses. Double-check against character designs (@Concept Artist in email). Topic: Character Model Proportions.
Initial pass on the head and facial features, focusing on overall shape rather than detail. Ensure it matches the concept art.  Save a new iteration: Character_Blockout_v01.
Lunch Break. Probably grab a sandwich from the cafe downstairs.
Begin blocking out the environment's largest structure, a ruined building. Focus on the overall silhouette and scale using simple cubes and planes in Maya.
Refine the building blockout, adding basic shapes for windows, doors, and large debris. Consider the composition and how it will frame the gameplay area.
Review progress, identify areas for improvement on both character and environment blockouts. Create a to-do list for tomorrow.
Clean up the workspace and back up files. Check emails again.
